page.title: 01Hadstock-general description
page.content: This area of gently rolling countryside lies partly in Essex and partly in Cambridgeshire. It is nearly all arable farmland, with some woodland, and the village of Hadstock at its eastern edge. Only a few hundred people live within the entire area, and there is only one through road, from Saffron Walden to Linton, running through Hadstock. Another lane runs into the western edge of the area from Great Chesterford. Part of the area is an old aerodrome, now mostly farmland again. A line of electricity power lines crosses the area from north to south. In some places, woodland or rough common land has been converted to ploughland, and hedges have been dug up to make the use of farm machinery more convenient.
